column8: The Jelebu Umno division has vowed to wrest back the Chennah state seat from DAP in the 14th General Election.Its chief Datuk Jalaluddin Alias said the confidence was based on the outcome of the programmes undertaken which have shown a positive impact with support from Barisan Nasional (BN) component parties."In the 13th General Election, we lost Chennah to the opposition, but this time we will not lose it again to DAP. This is not being boastful because I am confident that together with my component party friends, we can win it back."We want to present to Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Abdul Razak and Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan the gift of victory for the Jelebu parliamentary seat and the four state seats," he told Bernama.Jalaluddin said the failure of the opposition to look after the interests of the people was one of the main factors for the change in support towards BN.He added that he hoped the strong team spirit between Umno members and the component parties will continue to ensure the party's victory in GE14, which is due by June next year."Let us not be complacent, continue to help the grassroots," he said.In GE13, the Chennah seat saw a straight fight between Siow Foo Wen from BN and Anthony Loke Siew Fook from DAP.Siow lost to Loke by a majority of 1,098 votes.However, BN won other the three state seats, namely Sungai Lui, Klawang and Pertang, as well the Jelebu parliamentary seat. — Bernamahttp://www.thesundaily.my/news/2205882

Topic link: https://forum.lowyat.net/top: The MNP guy, its me yeah.
column8: You have to be a Chennah original resident to understand the situation there.

I wonder if RUU 355 would even be tabled before the GE.
